page.title: 02Transport _ Dunnington
page.content: The{A166}goes from York to Brid. The A1079 to Hull carries heavey frieght traffic.Some of this traffic has to pass through York but the rest goes North to Scarborough or South to Leeds on the A64 York by-pass which was opened in 1975 and has relieved York of much of its congestion.It passes underneath the Grimston roundabout. In 1913 the{Derwent Valley Light {Railway}opened a 16 mile track.At both ends it connected with the North Eastern main line.As agricultural traffic switched to road transport several firms established factories along side the line.These are the back bone of industry in this area now.The railway closed down in 1981. The{postman}makes two deliveries a day in Murton using a van ,and once a day, by bike,in Dunnington where there is a Post Office.
